lines.text: Let me do something for you. Let me take you to the airport, then I'll know you've forgiven me. Please!
Don't be spiteful. Understand me, I know you're not mean.
No, I can't afford the luxury.

[grabbing Hélène]
What do you mean? Come, tell me or I'll never forgive myself!

[trying to free herself and leave]
Don't be stupid! It won't be a disaster if I go alone!

[taking a bag of candies out of his pocket]
To make me happy, let me at least give you a candy.

[petulant]
That's enough! We're not kids anymore.
